oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Purina Checkerboard Time performances
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording contains excerpts from Purina sponsored Checkerboard Time radio segments, featuring Chick Martin (host/performer), the Cackle Sisters (performers), Swanee River Boys (performers), Carl Lambert (performers), and Sally Walker (performer). Second recording is Excerpt from an American Ace sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 23, 1948. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer), Tommy Magness (performer), Clyde and Marie Dilleha (performers), Jimmie Riddle (performer), Uncle Dave Macon and Son Dorris (performers) on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cackle Sisters; Swanee River Boys; Carl Lambert; Sally Walker; Chick Martin; Roy Acuff; Jimmy Riddle; Clyde and Marie Dilleha

Sisters) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Little Liza Jane (Cackle Sisters) -- [Unidentified] talks -- Trail Herding Cowboy (Cackle Sisters) -- Spanish Cavalier (Cackle Sisters) -- Martin) -- Granny Will Your Dog Bite (Carl Lambert fiddle) -- Chick Martin talks and dedicates the next tune to all grandmothers -- Leaning On The Everlasting Arms ([Unidentified]) -- Purina 'Three -- My Blue Eyed Jane (Swanee River Boys) -- Closing statements -- Chick Martin and Sally Walker talk -- Little Old Rag Doll (Sally Walker) -- Chick Martin talks and introduces the next tune -- Old Dog Acuff talks -- If I Could Hear My Mother Pray Again (Roy Acuff) (incomplete)
